theory_and_explanation: Focuses on maximal force production by recruiting high-threshold motor units. Uses heavy loads and low repetitions to improve neural efficiency and absolute strength.
breathing_style: Valsalva maneuver during lifts, controlled exhale at lockout
training_notes: Low reps, heavy loads, long rest to maximize force output

theory_and_explanation: Aims to increase muscle fiber size through mechanical tension, metabolic stress, and muscle damage.
breathing_style: Controlled breathing, exhale during concentric phase
training_notes: Moderate reps, high volume, shorter rest

theory_and_explanation: Improves the muscle’s ability to sustain repeated contractions over time with minimal fatigue.
training_notes: High reps, light loads, short rest

theory_and_explanation: Develops the ability to generate force quickly by combining strength and speed.
breathing_style: Sharp inhale before lift, explosive exhale
training_notes: Low reps, explosive intent, full recovery

theory_and_explanation: Maximizes calorie expenditure and metabolic stress to promote fat oxidation.
breathing_style: Fast controlled breathing to sustain intensity

theory_and_explanation: Enhances agility, coordination, speed, and sport-specific movement patterns.
Improves real-life movement efficiency by training multiple joints and planes together.
Builds relative strength and body control using bodyweight resistance.
Alternates short bursts of maximal effort with brief recovery to improve cardiovascular and metabolic conditioning.
Restores movement patterns, strength, and joint stability after injury.
